es.fnl.fsm
Interface Transition<E>

All Known Implementing Classes:
TestPatternMatcher.CharTransition
public interface Transition<E>

Transitions define how elements of a sequence should match to the pattern.

E.g., if the Pattern (a non-deterministic automaton) or the ExactMatcherBase (a deterministic automaton) should match a List of elements of some generic type E, i.e., a List<E>, the transitions define if the current element in the sequence is appropriate to allow the automaton to move on to its next state.

In the case of a character sequence automaton (i.e., in String pattern matching such as provided by Java's regex package), the matches(Object) implementation would return the Boolean result of Character.compareTo(Character) == 0 and be instantiated by defining the relevant character for the transition. Furthermore, for the backtracking mechanism provided by the Pattern FSA, a weight of each transition should be defined, while epsilon transitions default to a weight of Double.MIN_VALUE. The path chosen for backtracking then is the path that has the highest summed transition weights and therefore defines the matched sequence and capture groups. 

 class CharacterTransition implements Transition<Character> {
   private Character c;
 
   public CharacterTransition(Character toMatch) {
     this.c = toMatch;
   }
 
   public boolean match(Character other) {
     return c.compareTo(other) == 0;
   }
 
   public double weight() {
     return 1.0; // each character is of equal "weight"
   }
 }

Author:
Florian Leitner

Method Summary
 boolean matches(E element)

Method Detail

matches

boolean matches(E element)
A transition implementation must define if, given some unknown element, it is valid to make the transition or not.

Parameters:
element - an element from the sequence being matched
Returns:
true if the transition is valid, false otherwise.

weight

double weight()
A transition implementation can define a weight that is used in backtracking to evalute the path with the highest IC.

Returns:
a value that represents the information content of this transition
